intro: Leucopogon triqueter, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a shrub characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and coastal environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It is part of the Ericaceae family, which includes many other heath and shrub species. Leucopogon triqueter is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract native pollinators.
